abstract: Economists say that the punch from increased government spending has helped the economy begin to bottom out faster than it would have otherwise.
snippet: Economists say that the punch from increased government spending has helped the economy begin to bottom out faster than it would have otherwise.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Even as the Obama administration braces for another grim report about job losses on Friday, economists say that the president’s $787 billion stimulus package has helped blunt the downturn in limited but discernible ways.

headline.main: Economists See a Limited Boost From Stimulus
headline.print_headline: ECONOMISTS SEE A LIMITED BOOST FROM STIMULUS

abstract: Bank of America chief executive Kenneth D. Lewis may be facing more calls for his ouster because of the controversy following the firm’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch, but one well-known banking analyst has come to his defense.
snippet: Bank of America chief executive Kenneth D. Lewis may be facing more calls for his ouster because of the controversy following the firm’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch, but one well-known banking analyst has come to his defense.
lead_paragraph: Is Kenneth D. Lewis, the embattled chief executive of Bank of America, getting a bum rap?

headline.main: A Defense of Bank of America’s Chief
